item.title: How to Increase Fatigue/Stamina in Oblivion Remastered
item.description:
Stamina works differently in The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion Remastered than players may be used to, and the Fatigue system is one of the game's most contentious points. Fatigue is not just used for sprinting and attacking like in other RPGs. Instead, Fatigue dictates melee damage and affects other aspects of combat in Oblivion Remastered .

Because Stamina and Fatigue are so important, it's a good idea for players to increase their Fatigue as quickly as possible. Thankfully, there are quite a few ways to increase the Fatigue meter in Oblivion . Increasing Fatigue will also level up some other skills in the process, so well-rounded adventurers will naturally boost their Stamina meter as they progress through the game.

How to Increase Fatigue (Stamina) in Oblivion Remastered

There are multiple ways to increase Fatigue in The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion Remastered . The primary way of getting a higher Fatigue/Stamina cap is by increasing the Willpower attribute. In the original game, the player's maximum Fatigue value was the sum of their Strength, Endurance, Agility, and Willpower attributes. The remastered version of the game changes this so that Willpower has the greatest effect on a character's total Fatigue. The Agility attribute also slightly contributes to a player's total Fatigue level, and it also affects how quickly it regenerates . Some Birthsigns provide buffs to the starting values of these attributes for players who want to get a head start.

Every time a level is gained in Oblivion , players can enhance their attributes by a few points. The amount of points a player can dump into an attribute is determined by how many skill points they have gained in related skills. For example, players who spend time leveling up the Armorer and Block skills will be able to add more points to the Endurance attribute when they level up. Improving the Endurance attribute will also increase a character's maximum Health.

As such, players who want to increase their Fatigue as much as possible should focus on leveling up skills associated with Willpower and Agility . That way, more attribute points will be available upon leveling up. Because these attributes are fairly easy to level just by completing quests and defeating enemies, players will naturally extend their Stamina bars just by playing the game.

What Does Fatigue Do in Oblivion?

Stamina affects quite a lot in Oblivion , much more than just sprinting and power attacks. Firstly, Fatigue governs all melee damage in Oblivion . The lower a player's Fatigue meter, the less melee damage they'll do per swing. Spells aren't affected , though, so players can use magic while they wait for their Stamina to recover during combat.

If a character takes a hit that lowers their Fatigue below zero, they'll be knocked down until their Fatigue recovers enough. Thankfully, this isn't as punishing in Oblivion Remastered as it was in the original game, but it still happens. Stamina is recovered at a rate of 10 points per second, and certain healing items and potions can restore Fatigue even faster. Players should keep a close eye on their green Fatigue bars during combat to make sure they don't accidentally tire themselves out. Using enchantments or potions with the Fortify Fatigue effect will boost a character's maximum Fatigue value, too.

The Fatigue system can be annoying at times in The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion Remastered , but players can also use the system to their advantage with enchantments and poisons that drain enemies' Fatigue, making them much more vulnerable to attacks. Players can even design entire builds around the Fatigue system if they desire, leveling up specific skills to sap their enemies' energy.

item.title: Blue Prince: All Red Rooms & Their Effects
item.description:
Blue Prince is a game that revolves around discovery, problem-solving, detective skills, and a lot of RNG. Its a combination of multiple genres, but it merges them all quite well, delivering a cohesive and fun experience for the player that can keep you busy for quite a long time.

Drafting is one of the core mechanics of Blue Prince , and choosing the right room when drafting is very important when it comes to winning the game. Red Rooms are the big no-no rooms in the game that always come with some downside, but there is a benefit to drafting them in the right circumstances.

What Are Red Rooms in Blue Prince?

There are a few different types of rooms in Blue Prince , each boasting a few defining characteristics that make them stand out from the rest and give them importance in the overall flow of the gameplay.

Red Rooms are a type that always comes with a caveat. There are a total of eight red rooms in the game, and each has a major con that makes them an undesirable draft. Some have minor effects, like a lost coin and an extra step cost, while others have massive repercussions, causing players to lose half of their steps.

When Should You Draft Red Rooms in Blue Prince?

There are some scenarios in which it makes sense to draft red rooms in Blue Prince . They do have downsides, but some of them can be mitigated. Some rooms have hidden secrets, others have interactions with different rooms, while some are just good to draft despite their downside.

  • Firstly, the Gymnasium is one of the best red rooms in the game. It costs an extra step for you, but it has 3 doors, and its downside can be mitigated with the help of the Utility Closet. The Dark Room is just as good, and you should always draft it if you have a utility box in your manor.
  • The Archives are a bit more tricky. If you draft it, all future drafts will hide (or archive) one of the three choices. Its not recommended that you draft this early in the game, but it shouldnt be a big deal in the late game, especially if you have a lot of routes available.
  • The Maids Chamber is a horrible pick in the early game, but its great in the middle and late game if you have the Nursery already drafted.

You should hold on to your gems so you dont get caught red-handed with a set of bad choices.

  • The Weight Room has a lever for the south gate of the Antechamber. To access it, you need to break the wall behind the punching bag with a Power Hammer . There is also a good chance that the room will contain a broken lever, which can be used at the Greenhouse to open another Antechamber door.
  • The Furnace can melt the items in the Freezer if placed within a few ranks of it.
  • The Chapel holds clues to solving the Tomb puzzle. Additionally, if you solve the chess puzzle in the Precipice and choose the Bishop, youll be able to gain 30 coins instead of paying 1 coin when entering the Chapel.
  • The Lavatory is an inoffensive (if useless) room without anything going for it. Theres no real reason to draft it, as it is a dead end and doesnt have any special effects or secrets that could help you on your journey.
  • The Closed Exhibit doesn't have any downsides if you have the Security Keycard.

All Red Rooms in Blue Prince

All the red rooms, except for the Closed Exhibit, can be drafted at any point in your manor exploration. The Standard and Common rarity rooms are easy to find, while the Unusual or Rare rooms can be quite difficult to encounter. However, the Closed Exhibit is a Found Floorplan that only enters your draft pool after you've discovered it in the Drafting Studio.

item.title: Oblivion Remastered: How To Join The Thieves Guild
item.description:
For the players who love to mask themselves in stealth and shadow, the Thieves Guild is the perfect guild for them to join. A collection of pickpockets and burglars, the Thieves Guild celebrates their laws and their spoils together, and obtaining stolen goods and heists have never been more fun than they are in Oblivion .

Players can join the Thieves Guild in Oblivion , and below will be the exact steps players need to follow to do so in order to get one step closer to finding out who the Gray Fox is and obtain the Thieves Guild armor of their own to benefit their sneaky ways.

How to Join the Thieves Guild in Oblivion Remastered

The easiest method of joining the Thieves Guild involves investigating the wanted posters of the Gray Fox that are found around the Imperial City. After interacting with one of these wanted posters, players can i nteract with a guard and ask them about the Gray Fox , where players must repeat this dialogue with guards until they hear something about how " The beggars love him, especially in the Waterfront. " Now, head to the Waterfront District and interact with Puny Ancus , a beggar who can be bribed to talk about the Gray Fox if their disposition is high enough.

With over 80 dispositions, the beggar will reveal that they know the Gray Fox. If players select the option: Yes. I want to work with him, they will be directed to go to the Garden of Dareloth at midnight . Once it's midnight, head into the Garden of Dareloth and wait for an NPC to approach, called Armand Christophe, and talk to him about the Gray Fox, which will then provide players with the option to join the Thieves Guild, but players must have a high enough disposition of at least 60, so bribe him too.

Once Armand Christophe gives his instructions, players will receive the May the Best Thief Win quest. It's best to save here, as this quest involves a race to steal a diary against two other thieves. The best way to get the diary first is to run to the far east side of the Temple District within the Imperial City to find Amantius Allectus' House, where they can find the diary within the desk .

With the diary acquired, return to the Garden of Dareloth at midnight and give it to Armand in order to complete the quest and officially join the Thieves Guild.

If players fail to reach the diary first, then Methredhel will have it, and it can be stolen back from her by heading to her shack in the Waterfront District, where they must then lockpick a chest containing it.

item.title: Anbernic Suspends Shipments to the US
item.description:
Summary

  • Anbernic has stopped shipments to the US due to tariff hikes imposed by Trump, causing a lack of availability for certain products.
  • Other companies, like Square Enix, have also been affected by the tariffs, halting pre-orders on merchandise in the US.
  • Nintendo is redirecting Switch 2 consoles made in Vietnam to the US to avoid high tariffs, but the impact on pricing and availability is uncertain.

Retro handheld console maker Anbernic has recently suspended all shipments to the United States in the wake of Donald Trumps international tariff hikes. While gamers will still be able to purchase products that are currently already in the US, importing these goods from China will no longer be an option for Americans.

A few weeks ago, US President Donald Trump imposed trade tariffs on the whole world, shaking global markets and manufacturing chains. These tariffs include countries that manufacture many consoles, such as China and Vietnam. Some time after that, Trump exempted some electronics from tariffs, such as smartphones, but the same was not done for video game consoles. At the moment, China currently has tariffs of up to 145% on imports, which makes it difficult for Americans to import goods from the country.

Now, Anbernic, a popular manufacturer that makes cheap Game Boy clones, has suspended all US orders from China. According to The Verge, the company blamed the changes in US tariff policies and clarified that customers can still purchase goods currently stored in American warehouses, but it will not ship them from China to the US anymore. While many of Anbernics products are available in the US, some of them, such as the Anbernic RG CubeXX or the RG 406H, are only available if imported from China, and are currently unavailable for Americans. Anbernic has also stated that its currently trying to find a suitable solution for customers who were affected by fees before imports were halted.

US Customers Will Only Be Able to Purchase Anbernic Consoles Already in the Country

Anbernic is far from the only company in the gaming industry to be negatively affected by the tariffs. Last week, for example, Square Enix stopped pre-orders of merchandise in the US for the same reason as Anbernic. The decision still does not affect games, only merchandise, but this could change in the future.

Nintendo was one of the companies that has suffered the most from the tariffs in the last few weeks, stopping pre-orders for the eagerly awaited Switch 2 in the US. Earlier this week, pre-orders for the Switch 2 in the United States were finally resumed with the same prices as originally announced.

Unfortunately, its still impossible to tell if the United States may face a shortage of Nintendo Switch 2 consoles or if prices will change again. Nintendo is reportedly sending most of the Vietnam-made Switch 2 consoles to the US to avoid the high tariffs imposed on China, but only time will tell if this will be enough to satiate the demand for the new platform in the worlds largest economy.

item.title: Game of Thrones: Kingsroad Reveals Exclusive Look at Co-op Gameplay
item.description:
Summary

  • Game of Thrones: Kingsroad shared a new look at its Altar of Memories co-op mode.
  • Altar of Memories pits four-player teams against powerful bosses inspired by A Song of Ice and Fire mythology.
  • Game of Thrones: Kingsroad is currently only available as a Steam Early Access title, but is planned to soon make its way to Android and iOS devices, as well as the Epic Games Store.

Game Rant can exclusively share new Game of Thrones: Kingsroad footage. This latest look at the action RPG showcases its co-op gameplay, as well as several boss fights.

Created by Ni no Kuni: Cross Worlds developer Netmarble Neo, Game of Thrones: Kingsroad launched in early access on March 26. The game is currently only available on PC via Steam.

With the one-month anniversary of Game of Thrones: Kingsroad 's early access launch fast approaching, publisher Netmarble has shared some official footage from its latest title, which Game Rant can now exclusively reveal. The new promo materials consist of two clips, both of which showcase Altar of Memories, the game's co-op dungeons that pit four-player teams against a wide variety of powerful creatures.

GoT: Kingsroad's Ironbeak Griffin Can Be Taken Down With Traps

One of the newly shared videos features a fight against an Ironbeak Griffin, which showcases several Game of Thrones: Kingsroad gameplay mechanics, including traps. With careful coordination, players can work together to set and activate traps that temporarily immobilize the Ironbeak Griffin, creating an opening for combos and slow-but-powerful attacks that help push through massive damage. Traps are also an option against every other flying enemy that can be encountered throughout the Altar of Memories dungeons.

GoT: Kingsroad's Giant Ice Spiders Are Relentless Enemies

Netmarble's second video shows a fight against a Giant Ice Spider, a boss with a fairly self-explanatory name. These humongous enemies attack relentlessly and are capable of dishing out both single-target and area-of-effect damageoftentimes in quick succession. One strategy for taking them down is for the player party to perform simultaneous weak point attacks, which will eventually incapacitate them and create an opening for dealing serious damage. Both Griffins and Giant Ice Spiders are based on folktales from the A Song of Ice and Fire lore, including the stories that Old Nan tells Bran in A Game of Thrones .

The Game of Thrones: Kingsroad Steam page states that the action RPG is planned to stay in early access for at least four weeks. While this minimum testing period is nearly over, theres still no word on when exactly the game will see a full release. Whenever that happens, Game of Thrones: Kingsroad is planned to expand its reaches to the Epic Games Store, as well as Android and iOS devices. In the meantime, its early access version can be purchased via Steam for $24.99. The Deluxe and Ultimate Packs are priced at $49.99 and $89.99, respectively.
